Sys::Thread Class Reference

Thread Class. More...

Detailed Description

This class creates and manages new threads using POSIX calls.

Public Types

Public Member Functions

 Thread (int stack_size=4096, bool detached=true)
 Construct a new thread object. More...

 Sets the stacksize (no effect after create)

 Start the thread.
 
bool isrunning (void) const
 Check if the thread is running.
 
int wait (void **ret, int interval=1000)
 Wait for the thread to complete (joins thread if it is not detached)
 
void reset ()
 Reset the object (thread must not be running)
 

Static Public Member Functions

static void yield (void)
 Yield the processor to another thread.
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator
OTHER 

Default scheduling algorithm (SCHED_OTHER), the thread uses a round robin algorithm with a 0 priority value.

ROUND_ROBIN 

Spend up to the total round robin time on a task before switching, variable priority allowed

FIFO 

Stay in the thread until the thread yields (usleep(), read()/write(), other Thread::yield()), variable priority allowed

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Sys::Thread::Thread ( int  stack_size = 4096,
bool  detached = true 
)

This constructs a new thread object

Parameters
stack_sizeThe stack size of the new thread (default is 4096)
detachedWhether to create as a detached thread. If this value is false, another thread must use join() in order for the thread to terminate correctly.
